I'm just starting to use Cantera. Until now, I've been working 
Fortran77 and Chemkin. As an excercise, I converted my old Fortran77 
code (pyrol.f) so that it now calls subprograms of Cantera instead of 
those of Chemkin. But three of the subprograms (getMolecularWeights
(), SpeciesIndex() and getEnthalpy_RT()) called in pyrol.f are not 
explained in the manual f77.pdf. I found them in another manual 
(cantera12_f90.pdf), but it doesn't tell me how to include them in 
Fortran77-Cantera interface file (pyrol_ftnlib.cpp). I just made a 
guess to add them in cpp file, based on usage of other subprograms 
included in the manual, and I tried to compile them, but it failed 
with error messages related to those subprograms: Actually, I didn't 
see any error message on one of them, getEnthalpy_RT(), so this one 
may be correct. 

Could you please see the following, which is parts of pyrol.f and 
pyrol_ftnlib.cpp, and tell me how I should revise it? Thanks in 
advance. 

c Fortran77 commands in  pyrol.f
      DIMENSION x(10),y(10)
      parameter (nwt=101,nh=201)
      call getMolecularWeights(x)
      ic2h2=SpeciesIndex('C2H2')
      call getEnthalpy_RT(y)


// C++ commands in  pyrol_ftnlib.cpp
    void getmolecularweights_(doublereal* molwts) {
        _gas->getMolecularWeights(molwts);
    }

    integer speciesindex_(char* X, ftnlen lenx) {
        return _gas->SpeciesIndex_(string(X, lenx));
    }

    void getenthalpy_rt_(doublereal* x) {
        _gas->getEnthalpy_RT(x);
    }
